snippet: The Missouri auditor’s spokesman wrote “I just can’t take being unemployed again” before his apparent suicide, the authorities said Tuesday.
abstract: Spence Jackson, former employee of Missouri state auditor Tom Schweich, reportedly left suicide note citing prospect of unemployment as motive for killing himself; Schweich killed himself in February.
lead_paragraph: The Missouri auditor’s spokesman wrote “I just can’t take being unemployed again” before his apparent suicide, the authorities said Tuesday.

headline.main: Missouri: Unemployment Cited in Suicide Note
headline.print_headline: Missouri: Unemployment Cited in Suicide Note
